meanings.definition: To be bullied more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She felt outbullied by her classmates during recess.
meanings.sent2: He always seems to get outbullied by the older kids on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy looked like it was being outbullied by the bigger dogs in the park.
meanings.sent4: The small boat was outbullied by the larger ships in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The tiny seedling was outbullied by the towering trees around it.

meanings.definition: To have been bullied more than someone else in the past.
meanings.sent1: She had been outbullied by her older brother when they were kids.
meanings.sent2: He often talks about how he was outbullied by his classmates in elementary school.
meanings.sent3: The old teddy bear looked like it had been outbullied by years of playtime.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out book seemed to have been outbullied by the many hands that had held it.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned toy appeared to have been outbullied by neglect and time.
